stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Heavyrain
[Gender] Female
[Combat Experience] 5 Years
[Place of Birth] Sargon
[Date of Birth] Mar 3
[Race] Kuranta
[Height] 159cm
[Infection Status]
Medical tests have confirmed that no infection is present.

[Physical Strength] Excellent
[Mobility] Standard
[Physical Resilience] Standard
[Tactical Acumen] Standard
[Combat Skill] Standard
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Normal

Formerly a soldier under the wings of a previous Lord Ameer of Sargon, Heavyrain left its army after the betrayal of an ally has left her disillusioned, eventually making her way to Rhodes Island.
A seasoned combat veteran, she is currently active in a variety of missions as a defender operator.

Imaging tests reveal clear, normal outlines of internal organs, and no abnormal shadows have been detected. Originium granules have not been detected in the circulatory system and there is no sign of infection. At this time, this operator is believed to be uninfected.

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 0%
Operator Heavyrain shows no signs of Originium infection.

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.12u/L
Operator Heavyrain rarely comes into contact with Originium.

A bashful female Kuranta.
The first impression most operators have of Heavyrain is that she is gloomy. In a noisy, crowded environment, she always prefers to stand in the side quietly as though she is completely removed from all the bustling activity.
However, Heavyrain is far from asocial; those who worked with her before can attest to her gentle, attentive personality.
'She just doesn't know how to express herself.'
This is how most operators describe her in their evaluations of Heavyrain, and it is quite an apt description.

Prior to Heavyrain's onboarding, Rhodes Island has already had another former Sargon soldier, Spot. Nonetheless, because of his lazy personality, most operators don't tend to associate him with what they consider soldiers. The fact that Spot has himself admitted to leaving the Sargon army because he wanted to get away from military life certainly doesn't help. Therefore, Heavyrain might just be a better example of a Sargon soldier than Spot.
And while most people tend to forget Heavyrain's background as a soldier because of her bashful nature in their daily interactions, the moment she steps on the battlefield, her professional combat training is immediately apparent to any observers. Be it assessing the battlefield or executing the orders she is given, she is capable of carrying out the task on hand well without letting her personal views getting in the way. In Instructor Dobermann's words, 'If you're looking for a professional soldier, look no further than Heavyrain.'
That being said, Heavyrain is far from flawless.
Her shortcoming is particularly noticeable when her allies are injured or otherwise in danger. She becomes fretful and anxious and displays a level of aggressiveness not normally seen in her; this further causes her to lose her calm and ability to analyze her surroundings effectively.
This is not a fatal flaw, as she can usually regain her calm in a relatively short period of time as long as her commanding officer knows how to work with her. Yet the problem still remains. Owing to this, Heavyrain was assigned as a Defender operator by Instructor Dobermann. Furthermore, Instructor Dobermann has requested her to adopt a combat style that is practically entirely foreign to her. That is her main responsibility on the battlefield now—To defend her allies.

With Heavyrain's permission, this entry will serve as a record of the operator's past experience in Sargon:
Heavyrain's family is just like any other Sargon family. They are strict, quiet, and depressed.
Soon after she came of age, Heavyrain enlisted in her Lord Ameer's army, going on to achieve many great accomplishments for her Lord Ameer. However, because of her withdrawn personality, she wasn't able to develop a good relationship with most of her fellow soldiers. In the end, there was only a single person who befriended her.
However, during a confrontation with another Lord Ameer, Heavyrain found herself betrayed by her one and only friend. As it turns out, the friend had been planning on using her as a stepping stone to join the enemies.
Her entire squadron was wiped out in a single skirmish while her friend defected to the enemy Lord Ameer with information about their side. She alone was spared only to be used as a scapegoat for the chaos that unfolded.
Because of her aloofness, she was left without any support in the army, and she was almost sentenced to death by the military court, only finding herself spared thanks to the testimony of a survivor who managed to escape.
The betrayal had left her disillusioned, and, in the end, she used her accomplishments in the army to buy herself the opportunity to leave, becoming a mercenary thereafter.
However, the incident has left her even more sensitive than before. As a result, she found herself repeatedly running up the wall, and this eventually led her here to Rhodes Island.

Heavyrain's behavior on the battlefield can be easily explained by her past—
She yearns for acknowledgement. The army's oppressive environment has only served to put even more pressure on her, leaving her unsure of how to express herself. At the same time, it has also made her willing to trust anyone who shows her even the tiniest bit of goodwill.
Although Rhodes Island is home to operators with vastly different personalities, many of them are accepting of others. Heavyrain's introversion has hardly kept these operators from forming a friendship with her. Therefore, Heavyrain thinks of every last operator who has shown her a smile as someone she must repay with her very life, which is why she loses control of herself on the battlefield—she cares about them way too much, and she will not tolerate anyone hurting her friends.
Such a cute reason for someone so berserk.
Most of our operators realize that Heavyrain doesn't know how to express herself, but they most likely have never imagined that Heavyrain thinks that, for the kindheartedness they have extended to her, she should naturally repay the favor.
That said, adorable as it may be, we must remember that this mentality is unhealthy. Heavyrain herself knows as well, but she evidently doesn't know how to correct it.
Fortunately, the Doctor is at the top of the list of people whose kindness she must repay.
The time she has spent with the Doctor since her onboarding has clearly left Heavyrain very trustful of, if not outright dependent on, the Doctor, who has undoubtedly already come to understand this aspect of Heavyrain. Surely, the Doctor will be able to guide her on the right path and slowly help her learn to express her emotions and manage her relationships with others.

According to Heavyrain, she met Spot before and received his help when her squadron stopped by the city that Spot was garrisoned in at the time.
Supoosedly, Spot handed her a bottle of water and lent her a comic book when he noticed she was all alone and isolated from her fellow teammates.
Spot has himself noted that he has no recollection of this ever taking place.
'Heh, that happened? Hold up... This comic book thing rings a bell. No wonder I couldn't find it!'
Unfortunately, even though Heavyrain was really fond of the comic book, she later lost it during her time as a mercenary.
Spot didn't seem to care about this at all.
Thanks to this, however, Heavyrain can sometimes be seen in the corner of the break room, enjoying a comic book by herself.

skins.description:
An outfit commonly worn by Operators.
While not as practical as a uniform, it's what they find most comfortable.

An outfit that has been improved after the Operator's Promotion.
Custom-made to suit each Operator's experiences and needs, these outfits are designed to provide them maximum flexibility on any battlefield. Furthermore, this is all done without compromising the comfort that they've come to expect.

<color name=#ffffff>Vitafield [Foruiner] Series Classics/Tranquil Moss. For the explorer pursuing what remains. Made with special materials suited for all climates, meeting the harsh demands of complex environments.</color>

modules.desc:
Operator Heavyrain has demonstrated a remarkable aptitude for preservation of the front and resilience against the enemy.
The Field Operations Department has thus passed the following resolution:
This operator shall be appointed a Defender Operator during field operations to exercise Protector responsibilities.
In witness whereof,
This badge is hereby conferred upon the above named.

'They said you're a spy, that you betrayed us, but I won't believe it!'
'Weren't we best buddies? There's gotta be a mistake, right?!'
'It WAS you?! You—you betrayed us?!'
'Why?! I'm not going to believe it, not until you give me an answer!'
'Just say you're innocent, and I'll believe you!'
'You saved me before, and ever since then, you've been a savior to me...'
'Is that so? You don't—remember anymore?'
'Even so—it's a fact that'll never change to me... I could never lay a hand on you, even if it was an order!'
—Taken from Vol. 9, Ch. 6 of the comic book Field Raider

When the fresh-aboard-the-landship, former soldier of Sargon shrinks into a nook to read her comics, it's usually all quiet.
But today seems a little out of the ordinary. The other operators in the lounge all heard the stifled yet clear sobs, yet are surprised to find Heavyrain, comic book in hand, buried in a sofa in the lounge's corner—and yes, in tears.
This unusual situation leads them to discuss in private.

'Is there anything in that comic worth crying over?'
'Dunno. I always thought that series had kinda crappy art.'
'Then why...?'
'Y'know, why not just ask her directly?'
'Wait, wait! Hey, what if you end up touching a nerve?!'
'Then what's your idea?'
'I've got a plan.'

Maybe due to having his reading time interrupted, Spot, original owner of the comic he lent Heavyrain, yawns as he gets up, walks over, and pats her on the shoulders as she continues to cry.
'This comic's—'
Spot speaks very, very slowly. '—MC turns into a superhuman who singlehandedly blocks cannons by the end, and none of his team die. Apparently the one who betrayed them was a double agent who couldn't tell anyone about it, and every enemy gets redemption and surrenders one by one.'
The emotionless Spot continues, 'After the volume you're holding, the plot just falls apart.'

Heavyrain stops crying, her expression gone completely blank upon hearing spoilers far too convoluted for her turbulent emotions.
'So... the lead protects everyone, and his friend... didn't betray him?'
Heavyrain slowly shuts the comic.
It really is a sloppy plot. So sloppy and trite, her head hurts like a shield just took a whack at her brain.

But still...
It's a story. What's so bad about a happy ending where everyone's together?
And blocking cannons singlehandedly—k-kind of sounds a bit cool.

missionList.desc: During battle, have Heavyrain use Emergency Camouflage a total of 30 times (excluding Support Units)
Clear Main Theme 2-7 with a 3-star rating; You must deploy your own Heavyrain, and allow no Operators to be defeated

voice_lines.voiceText: Yes, I'll protect the Doctor.
I may sit down? No, I mustn't. I'm a bodyguard. As a bodyguard, I must protect my target no matter the time and circumstance... Am I perhaps being a bother, standing here next to you?
I've met Spot before... Oh, no, the squad I was a part of traveled through a city he was stationed in, and he gave me a hand then. He most likely doesn't remember. It's okay.
(I'm not sure what the Doctor is doing, but that looks so amazing...) Eh? Uh... I-I didn't say anything. You misheard, Doctor.
Doctor, you mentioned this just now, so I thought I'd bring you some. Umm, I'm not doing anything unnecessary, right?

Doctor, I'm so sorry. I rushed ahead by myself on my last mission... I noticed somebody was wounded, and it felt like the blood in my head just started to boil. I forgot your order and ran straight to her. I didn't mean to do that. P-Please don't hate me...
Umm, Doctor, were you looking for me...? No, I wasn't trying to hide from you, and I definitely don't hate you... It's just that... Sorry, I'm not sure how to explain...

When I was in the Sargon army, most people didn't like me, but there was one person who treated me really well. She was my best friend, but... in the end... she betrayed me. Doctor, I don't know anymore. I'm not sure how to trust anyone now.

(The Doctor is such a nice person. Everybody hates me, but he talks to me willingly. There shouldn't be any problem if I put my trust in the Doctor, right?) Oh, Doctor, I'm listening. Yes, I will always trust you. Whoever makes an enemy of you, they're making an enemy of me too!
(I kind of want to... watch the Doctor sleep.)
(Looks like a kind person, but is this guy really going to be as easy to get along with as Amiya said...?) Uh, um, I'm sorry, I-I was spacing out. Operator codename Heavyrain, reporting in.
Yes, I should be able to reach this level too.
(Amiya is here too. Am I getting fired...?) Eh? I'm getting promoted?
Doctor, is it okay if I don't get promoted...? No, everyone is being so kind... I'm a little scared...
By your command.
I'll do my best!
(I mustn't betray the Doctor's high hopes...)
Incoming!
I'm here.
Doctor, your orders, please?
Okay.
Right here will do.
Die.
Out of the way!
You're in the way!
Hmph!
Doctor, did I do okay?
Doctor, I can still fight.
Doctor, let me go after them.
Doctor, I'll protect you!
Rhodes Island is so big...
Ehhh?!
Doctor?! Please don't scare me...!
Arknights.

Doctor, Happy New Year. Since I came to Rhodes Island, you have cared much for me, but you've never expressed gratitude to me. So today, at the very least, I want to sincerely thank you. (Th-There, I said it! I… I didn't mess up, did I?)
Doctor, can I assist you in any way?

(The Doctor is so popular. Would someone of such stature really need a gift from someone like me…? But I really do want to give one…) Oh, what am I holding? Well, um, it's a gift. Please, accept it! Happy birthday!

(They're all surrounding the Doctor. That is to be expected, considering the Doctor's popularity… Oh, the Doctor is waving at me. Is there something behind me? Huh, the Doctor is coming over…) Ehhh, should I join in the festivities…? Alright.

building_skills.desc: When this Operator is assigned to the Control Center, increases Morale of all Operators in the Control Center by <@cc.vup>+0.05</> per hour.
When this Operator is assigned to be the Trainer in the Training Room, <@cc.kw>Defender</> Operators' Specialization training speed <@cc.vup>+30%</>

When this Operator is assigned to be the Trainer in the Training Room, increases the Specialization training speed of <@cc.kw>Defender</> Operators by <@cc.vup>+30%</>, and further increases this speed by <@cc.vup>+45%</> if training the skill to Specialization Level <@cc.vup>2</>
